Dear Mr. Britt:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
12/7/2021. An Exit Conference occurred with you on 12/10/2021. Due to the violations,
a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any
licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the ISEP and your contract. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 An explanation why previous corrective action plans have not
obtained and maintained compliance for rules found in repeat
noncompliance.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 calendar
days after placement in independent living and updated at least
once every 90 calendar days:
(o) Service plans as required in R 400.12419 and R
400.12420. If the youth has biological children, the service plan
must address the living arrangement for the child or children,
visitation/parenting time with the youth's biological children or a
clear explanation why this is not possible or appropriate.
One of seven service plans reviewed was five days late.
Repeat Violation- Cited under R400.12418(2)(b) Renewal.
2020.
R 400.12511 Independent living contract.
(1) When an agency terminates its independent living services
for a youth, the agency shall document all of the following
information in the case record within 30 calendar days of
termination of its services:
(c) A summary of the services provided during care and the
needs that remain to be met.
(d) Provision for any follow-up services.
Three of four closed youth records reviewed did not show
documentation of (c) and (d).
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
Nothing this inspection.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
4

FOM 722-6B Family team meeting
Types and Timeframes
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as outlined in
the following tables:
Case Plan Development/ Reassessment
-Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days before the
case plan due date.
-Permanent Ward Service Plan (PWSP) - within 30 calendar
days before the case plan due date.
Semi-annual transition meeting:
Within 30 calendar days after the youth’s 14th birthday and
every six months thereafter.
Two of five open youth records reviewed did not show
compliance:
 One record did not show documentation of an FTM for
the youth’s 7/15/2021-10/12/2021 USP.
 A second youth’s record did not show documentation of
semi-annual transition meeting due 11/20/2021, per the
last one documented as 5/20/2021.
FOM 722-8E Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary
The caseworker must complete the DHS-69, Foster
Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary, and upload to
MISACWIS within the timeframe required for the specified
action/change:
Case Closure/ Change in placement:
Within three business days of foster care and/or juvenile justice
program/case closure or a placement change.
One of four closed youth records reviewed showed the DHS-69
was completed four days late with respect to the youth’s
5/18/2021 case closure date.
FOM 722-9 Foster Care- Updated Service Plan.
Supervisory Approval:
Review and approve the USP within 14 calendar days of the
report.
Two of seven USPs reviewed were approved 21 and 37 days
late respectively.
5

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
I provided technical assistance and consultation related to the following:
R400. 12510 Independent living contract.
 The agency was apprised the independent living contract shall consistently
indicate the youth’s living location.
 The agency was advised that adding a line to the contract, which displays the
youth’s living location may aid it with this provision.
R400.12511(1)b) (2)(d) Termination.
 The agency was apprised it shall consistently document the youth’s new
location, and that the youth was provided their personal property and funds.
 The agency was advised developing a receipt acknowledgement form, which
the youth, or a social service worker, if applicable, signs related to such funds
and personal property, may aid it in showing compliance with (2)(d).
Uploading a social work contact that displays this provision may also aid it in
showing compliance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
As indicated above.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The incident related to special investigation 2021C0217022 initiated 4/13/2021. The
agency received a citation for:
 R400.12510(1) for Supervision, related to lack of budgeting documents with
respect to youth contract compliance. This was a repeat violation, cited in
SIR2020C0108050.
 R400.12510(2) for independent living contract, related to lack of
documentation of youth contracts.
6

The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan on 6/9/2021 related to
how it would upload documents to show rule compliance. It remains in compliance
with that corrective action plan.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
